result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen James Haight

records.addlTxt:
10:04 AM Defendant Stephen James Haight appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock appeared by video for Stephen James Haight.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR1261 tracking with 22CF123:
Atty Rock states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. Atty Rock waives time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 002444,
Payable Number: 75667,
Receipt Number: 22R 003871,
Amount: $20.00

10:16 AM Defendant Stephen James Haight appeared by video, in custody from Marquette County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR1261 tracking with 22CF123:
Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant has Attorney Stephanie Rock from Sheboygan.  Atty Juech states that he has her in Green Lake County.  Defendant was retained and he thought she knew about this case.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset one more time so counsel can appear
bond continued

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on the traffic matter.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol   *Defendant is to submit to a breath test at the request of Law Enforcement with reasonable suspicion of alcohol

3:34 PM Defendant Stephen James Haight appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is going to get an Attorney.
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $15,000 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant does not have a response.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $15,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*Defendant is to submit to a breath test at the request of Law Enforcement with reasonable suspicion of alcohol
Initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
